summary: The Tax Return Preparer Accountability Act of 2025 aims to regulate tax return preparers. It amends Title 31 of the United States Code to empower the Secretary of the Treasury to oversee preparers, including setting minimum competency standards through education, examinations, background checks, and identifying numbers. It also mandates the IRS to implement an algorithm to identify taxpayers at risk of economic hardship and sets security standards for tax software providers.
